lexUnit.name: tunic.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a short, coat-like garment reaching

sentence.text: The short brown gym tunic with its blue and gold woven girdle that I wore on my first day at Elmwood was a symbol of entry into a new world of lady-like refinement and academic elitism .
Among the listeners I was caught by one young man in a saffron-coloured tunic with a wreath tilted over his forehead .
Lexandro stripped off his mustardy cadet 's tunic , and boots , and loincloth quickly and stood naked .
Hastily the reluctant guests began to shed their tunics , loincloths , and boots .
Slowly she began to strip off her clingtight black tunic , and so to become more visible .
We have both shed our school tunics and are wearing uniform of a different kind : blue jeans , and T-shirts and black PVC macs , which now hang like oil slicks on the back of the door .
The younger of the pair , Joseph noticed , held his arms unnaturally high across his tiny chest , and looking closer he saw a little bulge rumpling and moving beneath his silk tunic .
Inside the Scout Hut were assembled many more children in Brownie tunics and , after their ritual song and dance , I was launched into my part of the meeting .
" You were n't always in a gym tunic .
The Persian Guards , the 10,000 ` Immortals " , so-called because there was never a vacancy in their ranks , also had body-armour of metal scales sewn on to leather tunics , but few others had any .
A girl in an apple-green school tunic advanced on me , her hand raised as if to give me a slap .
She was wearing black trousers topped with a belted tunic in thin grey wool , high-buttoned almost to the chin , and deep-cuffed .
With his left hand he tore open the tunic of his uniform and drew up the undershirt , baring the flesh .
He was a youngish fellow , dark of hair and eyes , and modestly clad in a plain green tunic over buff-coloured leggings .
He had put a sleeveless tunic over his shirt of mail , and the Brecbennoch clung to it , undisturbed by the pace of his horse .

Gentlemen ushers in knee-length black tunics fuss about , directing last-minute guests to their seats , although most have been waiting for the best part of an hour , making stilted smalltalk to conceal their pride .
A meat saw roared , scattering sawdust , worked by a butcher in a white tunic .
He wore a red-and-gold headdress , and a white tunic trimmed with the same colours .
On state occasions Charles dressed in a tunic and cloak embroidered with gold wire , fastened with gold buckles .

Joseph looked out through the windows and saw three small Annamese children dressed in traditional silk tunics like their parents walking on the lawns below the terrace in the company of a plainly garbed Annamese servant .
D'Aubigny was dressed simply in a dark brown tunic like a forester and I gathered he was about to go hunting .
He reached into his tunic and took out a golden disc on a short chain .
She shivered , without knowing why , and he took off his tunic and wrapped it around her shoulders .
Then she took off his tunic and gave it back , helping him into it , fastening the buttons possessively .
The officer smiled , then began to unbutton his tunic .
It is equally important when she is wearing a soft tunic or one-piece tights and leotard .
Vitali wore a black tunic stitched with purple runes which were hardly visible .
He is wearing a blue tunic and around his shoulders is a fur cloak made of the skins of the hyrax .
Her lover had a romanesque skirted tunic and a short cloak .
W. S. We had tunics with two pockets there and two pockets here , where kept our ` fixings " .
